performances.venue: Old Renaissance Faire Grounds Veneta, OR
performances.description: Too beautiful for words
Long version that will not disappoint.  Donna adds a wonderful touch to this slow mellow beauty!
As heartfelt as the Europe versions.  Worth a listen.  Lots of epic stuff on DP 23.
A shining example of how truly refined, fine, and delicate the Dead could be, especially Keith
So wonderful...no point arguing best-evers, just know that it DOESNT GET ANY BETTER than this
As good as any, and better than most.
Ladies and Gentlemen version ... absolutely gorgeous ... and no Donna screaming!
Great gospel vocals from everyone and Keith's piano is wonderful.
Great version from a great second set.
Elegance defined. Some of the sweetest vocal harmonies of the era. Nailed it.
Another near-perfect Europe 72 version
Perfect.  May have the best vocal harmonies of all of them.  Not here because of low-level boards? Try headphones, heads.

performances.venue: Yale Bowl, Yale University New Haven, CT
performances.description: I love Jerry's singing throughout this fine show.
Beautifully Sung... Merle Haggard would be proud!

performances.venue: Oklahoma City Music Hall Oklahoma City, OK
performances.description: Gorgeous the whole sequence of He's Gone->Truckin->O1->SMBH is just breathtakingly powerful only the Dead could pull this much power and emotion off.
So sweet and sad, with a giant of a solo and crisp harmonising.
These versions from '71 are just SOOO GOOOOD!
It’s always soulful in ‘72
Cant beat this New Years Eve vocals are perfect and spot on!!!!
another beautiful version, love this jail cell lament this is gorgeous
Forgotten or overlooked, but melts-in-your-mouth sweet.  More of a triumphant blues than the gospel beauties from '72.

performances.venue: Davis Gym, Bucknell University Lewisburg, PA
performances.description: Saddle up heads, this is one of the nicest ones I know. Pre-Donna Jean, but the boys cover it with driving intensity and its nicely mixed for the era.

performances.venue: Fillmore East New York City, NY

performances.description: one of the best pre donna versions available
Awesome version - Donna's harmonies sound like a gospel choir. Love It !

performances.venue: East Hall, Franklin & Marshall College Lancaster, PA
performances.description: Pure Jerry magic.  Thorougly enjoyable!

performances.venue: Wallace Wade Stadium, Duke University Durham, NC
performances.description: WOw unbelivably powerful pre donna Sing Me Back Home
Show has a metallic twangy sound, to great effect here: turns this sweet tune into a hot industrial number.
Anothergorgeous run at this classic, Both Donna and Jerry ae just so on here a true beautiful moving classic

performances.venue: Grand Prix Racecourse Watkins Glen, NY
performances.description: Gives me chills, something about how Garcia sings this one is mesmorizing. Hair raising solo after the second verse too.

performances.venue: Fillmore East New York City, NY
performances.description: Dead with Duane
Spiritual Dead
It’s always soulful in ‘72. This one is no exception
Sweet version.
emotional back to back ballads of wharf rat and sing me back home
One of my absolute favorite Grateful Dead covers, so much power and absolutely cathartic journey is taking during this beauty.
Absolutelt gorgeous take on the old tune of a death row prisoner. Sung with such passion and depth truly moving.
